Backend

Class UserDataBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.UserDataBase

  • public class UserDataBase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the abstraction for a database containing User objects. Every function conducted to users such as modifying them or retrieving them are done through this abstraction.

    The abstraction ensures a single copy of the UserDataBase exists at any given moment by reading from and writing to the file system at every operation. This ensures data integrity.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UserDataBase.UserDataBaseWriter
      This class is the abstraction of the database I/O.

    • Method Detail

      • doesUserExist

        public static boolean doesUserExist(java.lang.String username)
        The method identifies if a User exists in the file system database based upon its uniquely identifying username.
        Parameters:
        username - A String object with the unique username.
        Returns:
        The boolean true if the user exists in the database, false otherwise.

      • retrieveUser

        public static User retrieveUser(java.lang.String username)
        This method will return a User object corresponding to the username input in the method.
        Parameters:
        username - A string of the unique username
        Returns:
        A user object if the user is found in the database, otherwise null is returned

      • retrieveUser

        public static User retrieveUser(User user)
        This method will return a User object corresponding to the user object input in the method. It performs a deep compare to do this identification.
        Parameters:
        user - A user object to find.
        Returns:
        Null if the user does not exist in the database, otherwise the User object in the database.

      • addUser

        public static void addUser(User user)
        Adds a User object to the database and updates the file on the hard drive immediately. Only does so if the username does not already exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to be added

      • isValidPassword

        public static boolean isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if the password is valid or not based on the specifications. A valid password satisfies each of the following properties: 1. Must contain 8 characters 2. Must contain at least one lower case letter 3. Must contain at least one upper case letter 4. Must contain at least one number 5. Must contain at least one symbol (non-alphanumeric).
        Parameters:
        password - A String object containing the password to check
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid, else false;

      • modifyUser

        public static void modifyUser(User user)
        This method takes in a User object and sets the entry in the database to that user object passed in. This method overwrites all existing data for that user in the database with the parameter data.

        This method assumes the username of the input user will be the user to search for. This method performs it's search based on the username.

        Parameters:
        user - A user object containing all the items to change to

      • getAllUsers

        public static java.util.LinkedList<User> getAllUsers()
        Returns a LinkedList of all of the Users in the database.
